{"step_by_step_thinking": "To assess outcome from labour, cost, and time, we need to consider the cost-effectiveness of different interventions. Cost benefit analysis compares the costs and benefits of different interventions to determine if the benefits outweigh the costs. Cost utility analysis measures the cost-effectiveness of interventions by considering the quality-adjusted life years gained. Risk benefit analysis assesses the risks and benefits of different interventions. In this case, the most appropriate choice would be cost effectiveness analysis, which compares the costs and outcomes of different interventions to determine the most cost-effective option.", "answer_choice": "B. Cost Effectiveness"}
